verses.verse: (A Psalm of David, when he fled from Absalom his son.) O Lord, <WH3068> how <WH4100> my adversaries <WH6862> have increased! <WH7231> Many <WH7227> are rising <WH6965> up against <WH5921> me.
Many <WH7227> are saying <WH559> of my soul, <WH5315> "There <WH369> is no <WH369> deliverance <WH3444> for him in God. <WH430>" Selah. <WH5542>
But Thou, O Lord, <WH3068> art a shield <WH4043> about <WH1157> me, My glory, <WH9202> and the One who lifts <WH7311> my head. <WH7218>
I was crying <WH7121> to the Lord <WH3068> with my voice, <WH6963> And He answered <WH6030> me from His holy <WH6944> mountain. <WH2022> Selah. <WH5542>
I lay <WH7901> down <WH7901> and slept; <WH3462> I awoke, <WH9516> for the Lord <WH3068> sustains <WH5564> me.
I will not be afraid <WH3372> of ten <WH7233> thousands <WH7233> of people <WH5971> Who <WH834> have set <WH7896> themselves against <WH5921> me round <WH5439> about. <WH5439>

Arise, <WH6965> O Lord; <WH3068> save <WH3467> me, O my God! <WH430> For Thou hast smitten <WH5221> all <WH3605> my enemies <WH340> on the cheek; <WH3895> Thou hast shattered <WH7665> the teeth <WH8127> of the wicked. <WH7563>
Salvation <WH3444> belongs to the Lord; <WH3068> Thy blessing <WH1293> [be] upon Thy people! <WH5971> Selah. <WH5542>
